predicate.note: Frames file for 'position' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Comparison to 'set' and 'call'.

roleset.name: put in a particular location, or describe

role.descr: location or position, or attribute of arg1

example.name: verbal
example.text: One investment banker said Mr. Steinberg may be trying *trace* to position himself as a friendly investor who could help UAL Chairman Stephen Wolf revive a failed labor-management bid.
example.arg: a friendly investor who could help UAL Chairman Stephen Wolf revive a failed labor-management bid

example.name: adjectival, sorta
example.text: He attributed the unusually high volume to broad-based selling on fears that the Thatcher government may be in turmoil and Britain's Labor Party positioned *trace* to regain control of the government and renew efforts at nationalization.
example.arg: to regain control of the government and renew efforts at nationalization

roleset.note: The latter example actually effectively has S[ NP[ Britain's Labor Party] VP[ regain control...]]. Damn those ECM verbs already!
